intro: Hyptis colubrimontis, commonly known as the mountain hyptis, is a species of flowering plant native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
